text: Tap at Garden House Crafts in Tokyo. Bright golden colour. Sweet malty taste and a tad bitter. Dry finish. Refreshing.

4.8%ABV. Lager.

Tapped out gold. 6ºSRM.

Nose is actually pretty floral of a lager with some nice citrus notes like ripe lemons or just ripe oranges, grapefruit juice.

Mouthfeel is watery. Palate has some nice clean pale malt and wheat malt flavors with bread dough and white bread predominating. Hops are aggressive and bitter with grapefruit peel, lemon and lime zest. Some cilantro spice, but overall populated with fresh, citrus, herbaceous and grassy flavors.

Finish is clean, lightly beery.
Cloudy golden color. Frothy white head. Huge hoppy nose with honey dew and citrus notes. Mouth is full on bitterness. Definitely an ipl.
Draught at Garden House Crafts. Rich apricot and peach fruitiness from the hops, decent malt base, fairly smooth and refreshing, would probably be even better paired with the actual Illegal burger.
Tap at the summer pop up. Hoppy, caramel maltiness, something pine like. Nice, refreshing first drink. Quite malty but decent bitterness.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden. Lightly hoppy aroma. Light bodied, smooth. Refreshing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at dobre casy. Clear golden colour with white head off. Aroma of citrus fruits. Taste of grapefruit,lemon,malt, light bitter aftertaste. Good drinkable

Tap at Brewdog Birmingham. Poured a hazy light amber with a thin white head. The aroma is grassy hop citrus. The flavour is moderate to light bitter with a crisp citrus, toothpaste hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

Huge thanks to Petar for sharing this with Pornoguru and me (and others). Poured a misty amber bodd. Mild, quite mild tropical fruit aroma hop nose. The same continues on taste, reminding a little of aloe (nice catch by Pornoguru), Solid, medium bitterness balances it out. This is a lovely, well crafted little lager - great job Mikkeller!
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours hazy amber with a small white head. Aroma is pretty grainy, hoppy, citrussy, orange peel. Taste has corn, grain, citrus and some hoppy notes.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours light golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, grain, grass, light fruit, peach. Flavor is malt, grainy, bitter grassy hops, light citrus. Thin to medium body, average carbonation, dry and light bitter finish. Nice and really easy to drink. 171015

Aroma and taste is grassy and grainy, citrus lemon, straw, some more tropical and floral hoppy nuances throughout, medium to light in body, with a clean crisp finish.
Golden with white head. Tropical fruit, citrus and light spice. Sweet, spicy and floral finish. Overall: enjoyable alongside a burger.

Sample c4. Pours golden with a Little white head. Aroma of fresh hops, light malts, piney, tropical, light grain. Taste is hoppy,with a decent amount of sweetness, tropical, bitter and quite dry finish for a premium lager. That said I like it. High drinkability.
From tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Clear golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, fruit and spice.
Tap clear golden colour with medium white head.Aroma is dry bitter with harsh dry taste of grass and hops a bit greapfruits note and nice bitter finish.
On tap at Mikkeller Viktoria. Golden with white head. Aroma reminds me of German pilsner, malty, slight yeast and bread. Taste is similar, malty and bread with som herby hops and grass.
Milder, hopfig herber Antrunk. Der Hopfen sinkt, die Herbe bleibt konstant, süffig. Trocken getreidiger Mittelteil, rund. 10/9/10/10/8/9

Big coarseish white head. Clear yellow body with light carbonation.
Resiny gooseberry aroma with dusty notes, quite faint. Very dry, and
quite salty, resiny gooseberry taste. Mid-bodied. Sharpish
mouthfeel. Dry resiny tropical fruit aftertaste with funky notes.
Its not bad, but its very dry and austere, and I dont really like
the hop character that much. (0.33l bottle, I dont know where from.)

cereal, resin, floral, citrus, 
golden, hazy, frothy, 
medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, lively, bitter, 
Great lager!!!

Bottle @ Illegal Burger, Oslo. Golden colour, decent white head. Not that much of an aroma, some sweetness, light citrus, a little hops. Pretty much the same from the taste, quite dry beer with a medium sweetness from the malts, citrus, not much hops from the finish. Its quite refreshing, but not that exciting. The palate was a bit boring as well. Reading some of the other reviews I assume I might have gotten a quite old bottle, the last they had in the fridge, since the hops were hardly recognizable.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours slightly cloudy yellow with a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are citrus peel, grains, and herbs - with a dry finish.

Keg at the Kings Arms, London during the Mikkeller tap takeover. Pours clear yellow-gold with a foamy white head. Great hops, moderate sweetness. Fresh citrus. Clean, crisp. Light bodied with average carbonation. Moderately dry on the finish with crisp pale bread, a bit of rindy citrus. Solid.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, ViktoriagadeCloudy blond color, small head. Very fruity, fresh aroma; tropical fruits are most prominent; then, a bit of manure. Lean mouthfeel, dry; there is some delicate nice malt flavor, a bit crispy, but hidden by the strong bitterness; the hops are resiny, lightly fruity too.Refreshing, very nice.

Backlog rating. Keg at the Kings Arms tap takeover. It pours a hazy straw color with a small white head. Aroma is quite hoppy with citrus peel, grass, tart apricots and hay. Taste is bitter and grassy with pint hops, grapefruit, grains, biscuit. Finishes dry and bitter, grainy. Light bodied with good carbonation. Overall, tasty lager with a nice hops presence
Cloud dark yellow. Strong hop nose; citrus. Flavour is nice, hoppy, good malt base. Sessionable.
Translucent gold colour. Cascade citra aroma. On tap at beer revolution. Vg premium lager.
DØE. Hazy yellow with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - flowers and fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 240514
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, malt, grapefruit. Flavour is citrus, malt, hop, pine, grapefruit, peaches. Medium body. OK beer.
Noe søtlig duft av appelsin og citrus. Dunkel lys gulbrun farge. Tynt hvitt dekkende skum. God frisk smak av appelsin med noe citrus i ettersmak.

On tap at BeerTemple. Hazy cloudy gold pour with creamy white head. Aroma is hoppy, peppery and piney hops, very hoppy. Taste is bitter, hoppy, very low malt profile, very clean hop forward flavor. Palate is light bodied, surprisingly creamy, very smooth and silky light carbonation, pretty unique texture, quite enjoyable.

Appearance: Golden color with a fine white head. Good lacing.Aroma: Citrus hoppy and nice fruity.Palate: Medium body. Moderate sweet and a fine bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Citric hoppy, tropical fruity and a fine malty back.Overall impression: A really nice and fresh beer. The most surprisingly is that the burger bar do not stink burgers. A really good match.Personal stats: Bottle at Illegal burger in Oslo, Norway
Poured a milky light amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of sweet citrus. Light to medium body, flavour is moderately sweet orange, lightly bitter.

Tap @ DØE, 14. Clear golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop, little citrus and a little grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, little earthy, little citrus, medium sweet and a little bitter.
Draught at KØ14. Good fruity aroma. Clear orange colour. Small white head. The flavour is mildly fruity. Has a quite dry hoppiness. Chalky mouthfeel.
Nose is sweet corn, decent cooked vegetables, piss whiff, cereal, feel is mediumwatery, taste is sweet mint, grass note, rosehip, later mint, dry decent hops finish

At B&F in Rome. Pours hazy yellow with a huge white foamy head. Nose is a bit flat, being a lager. Mouth is gently bitter but also malty. A good lager!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 330ml @ Hostel room - Anker Hostel, Oslo
Pours clear golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, citrus and pine. Taste is light to medium sweet and light to medium bitter. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
Draught at BlackDoor. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, floral hops, toast, pine and a bit of mango. Bitter finish with hops, pine and citrus. Excellent lager.

Draught (5.8%) @ Black Door
Aroma is nice with fruity hops and some peaches. Flavour has fruity hops, gooseberry bush leaves and some peaches Finishes with some minerals and herbal bitterness. Nice.

Tap (Kaunis Kampela, Helsinki, Kalakierros 2014)
Plasticky pale lager aroma. Pale straw, tiny head. Simple plasticky lagery taste too. Fizzy palate, watery, gassy, even. Finish has some slight citrus hop notes. This is why I dont like lager. Burps like lager. Hooray - its finished - never again!
Tap at Kaunis Kampela, Helsinki. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, some fruits, hints of hops and malts.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Clear golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Malty biscuit aroma, caramel, herbal notes, grassy, some citrus. Hoppy grassy flavor, cereal, biscuits, hay, floral, some citrus. Nice hop finish.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm. 

A bit hazy golden with a medium white head. Fresh aroma of citrus, malt, hay and hops. Similtar taste. Refreshing and easy to drink. The finish was dry.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends, Stefansgade 35, DK-2200 Copenhagen N, Denmark. [ As Mikkeller Illegal ].Clear medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, pale malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, pine, citrus, hop oil. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, hop oil, citrus - fruity, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140131]

Bottle. A clear, golden beer topped by a big white head. The aroma has citrus peel, peaches and pink grapefruit, not much maltyness going on. Theres a little touch of pale malts in the flavor, as well as bitterness and all the fruityness found in the aroma. Medium body and a plant carbonation level. An easy drinkable beer, quenching and well suited for burgers or mowing the lawn. 140307

7th March 2014Kings Arms, Bethnal Green. Keg at the Mikkeller tap takeover. Light haze on this gold beer, small white head. Palate is light and dry and a little crisp. Light dry malt with super light cream. Good orange and grapefruit peel hops. Dry crisp finish with a good peel linger. More pale ale than lager but nice enough.

A few 330ml bottles from Vinmonopolet Bodø Sentrum. Hazy pale golden. Diminishing white head. Mild dry aroma with peaches. Moderate taste of orange, peach and pale malts. Subdued bitter endnotes. Medium to thin bodied. Unvaried, session beer (Shared with good friends in Liv and Kjells Bierstube, Bodø 28.02.2014).
Keg at the kings arms mikkeller tap takeover. Aroma is bursting fresh lemon, midget gems, orange, lychee. Flavour is crisp pils malt, nice tropical fruit. Super clean. Really drinkable.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with an off-white head. Aroma of peach, grapefruit, some malt and fruitiness. Flavor is sweet and somewhat bitter with some peach and pine. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika enjoyed at home
Golden hazy, big beige head. Smells of apricotes and other tropical fruits, dust and malts. Moderate sweet, quite clean and crisp. Moderate bitter finish, some nice hops. Very refreshing and high drinkability factor

Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Gylden , litt uklar farge. Stor hvit skumtopp som forsvinner raskt. Medium karbonert. Smaker sitrus, furunål gjær og malt. Noe frukt og krydder.En frisk, spenstig lager med lett bitter ettersmak. Ganske god
Tap at Mikkeller viktoriagade cloudy yellow smooth white head. Aroma is very flowery, exotic flowers, citrus, super fresh. Flavor is pine grapefruit citrus and malts. Lots of flavor. Also crisp.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2014 Lys med medium skum. Lukter blomster, humle, malt og til og med litt frukt. Smaken er frisk og god, her er humle, noe frukt og gress. Mild og lun først, så setter en fin mild bitterhet inn. Den blir der i ettersmaken også. Nokså tørr.
Lys gul klar med hvitt skum. Grapefrukt, humle og blomsterlukt. Bitter humle i smak. Tørr, lang bitter ettersmak

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Clear golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and citrus peel with notes of pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops, citrus peel and pine needles.
Hoppy finish.
On bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Golden color, good foam. Immediate hoppy aromas, some fruitiness, also citrus. Medium body & complexity. Good bitterness & balance. Enjoyable

Bottle. Pours a hazy light orange body and a small white head. Nose is citric peel, grass, peaches and hints of pale malts and straw. Taste is bitter grassy tones, red fruits, hints of grass. Long near-medicinal bitter aftertaste. Light body, soft to medium carbonation. Refreshing enough, but perhaps a bit too astringent bitterness.

0.33L bottle from Vinmonopolet. Light clear golden colour, with quickly disappearing white head. Aromas of citrus, barley and lots of hops and fruits, very nice nose. Taste is hoppy, lots of citrus fruits, a bit spicy. Crisp, dry and bitter finish. Highly drinkable.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet.Pours clear golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma of citrussy and grassy hops. Taste is light sweet malty, spicy and honey notes, very dry and bitter finish, grassy and herbal hops, nice and a very hoppy premium lager.

(Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends) Pours all clear and golden with a big but quickly fading, frothy head. Smells nice and flowery for a pilsner, but still with a evident pilsner background. Good full and carbonated mouthfeel, quite bitter and a little sweet is the first two thoughts to appear. Get some crispiness from the malts and some citrus from the hops, but thats it. Good pilsner, boring if youre looking for something more.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 10.11.2013, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly fresh, light malts, hops, hay, lawn, hints of grain and citrus. Taste is fresh and slightly dry, almost kind of bretty, light malts, citrus peel, hops, lawn, leafs, hay, yeast. Longlasting mild bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Pretty nice for being a lager.
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy yellow color with a white head. Has a fruity malty grainy peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty grainy weak honey flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy weak grassy finish.

Draft 0,25l at Oslo Beer Festival. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma of grass, fruit, citrus and lemon. Same for taste. Smooth fruity and bitter dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a 33cl bottle at Oslo ølfestival. Clear golden with a white head. Hoppy aroma with citrus, grass, pale malt with some lightly fruity notes and hints of pine. Moderate sweet and very flavourful for a premium lager. Nice and solid bitterness and quite refreshing. Bitter aftertaste with notes of citrus. Nice one!
Bottle at MikkellerBAR. Clear golden - white head. Citrus freshness. Light bitterness. Toasted. Nice freshness. Zesty. Orange. Cactus. Light malty. Dry toasted malty finish. Nice high drinkability.

Bottled. A golden beer with a huge white head. The aroma has notes of hops, spices, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw, malt, spices, and hops, leading to a bitter finish. The body is light.

Bottle shared at Mikkeller & Friends by the local ratebeerians, thanks guys! An incredibly resinous aroma-it smells like weed. A cloudy gold pour with a piney hop taste. Simple body but overall a decent beer.

Bottle at Mikkeller. Grassy hop, bit of skunk, some biscuit. Brig clear yellow. Bready malt, lemon hops, bitnofncardboard, nice bitterness. Light but smooth
 Decent.
33 cl bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Skinny and grassy. Bigger, grassy, citrusy to lemonish. Smooth fruity and bitter dry finish.
